model

Class FileHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.FileHandler

  • public class FileHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Processing and parsing of RLE-files. This class is capable of reading and parsing RLE-files. The RLE-file is read from a source with a Reader in the method convertToReader and then temporarily stored in an ArrayList. The different elements of the ArrayList are extracted in the decryptRLEFile and processed further from that point. The elements related to information about the RLE-file are extracted with the extractBoardInfo method, the rule set of the RLE-file is decoded in the parseRuleString method and the pattern of the RLE-file is processed in the fillBoardArray-method where the pattern is stored in the byte[][], rleArray for further usage.

    • Method Detail

      • convertToReader

        public void convertToReader(java.io.File f)
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            PatternFormatException
        Converts a File into a Reader object. Uses method readBoard to extract content of File given as an argument. The exceptions from this method are thrown to the caller.
        Parameters:
        f - the File that is to be converted to a Reader object
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if it occur errors related to creating a FileReader from the File
        PatternFormatException - exception related to the format of the RLE-file

      • decryptRLEFile

        protected void decryptRLEFile(java.util.List<java.lang.String> stringsInRle)
                       throws PatternFormatException
        Converts the stringsInRle to a single String, rleString. The information stored in the header of the RLE-file is extracted through extractBoardInfo and placed into respective information containers. If rule set is found in the RLE-file this is assigned to the variable ruleSet and if no rule set is found, a PatternFormatException is thrown to notify the user. Information about the board is also extracted and sent as a parameter to method fillBoardArray that creates a byte[][] which is set as the board in a Board -object.
        Parameters:
        stringsInRle - the contents of the RLE-file as a ArrayList
        Throws:
        PatternFormatException - thrown if there are format errors in the RLE-file
        See Also:
        extractBoardInfo(String)

      • extractBoardInfo

        protected void extractBoardInfo(java.lang.String rleString)
        Extracts board information from the RLE-file. The method uses regular expressions to extract information from lines of text marked with an information tag and places these lines of text into different information containers if the RLE-file contains this meta information.
        Parameters:
        rleString - the String representing the board in String-format

      • parseRuleString

        public static void parseRuleString(java.lang.String ruleStringTemp)
        Processing of the rulestring parsed from the RLE-file. This method checks if the rulestring obtained from decryptRLEFile contains B|b|S|s and assign bValue and sValue their respective values. If however the rulestring is in the format \\d*[\\/]\\d*, then the parser-method will interpret this in the form survival counts/birth counts as is the norm. The parameter ruleStringTemp should be either on the form: "B[number of required neighbor cells to change state from 0 to 1]/S[number of required neighbor cells to maintain state 1 if state already is 1]" or on the form: "[number of required neighbor cells to maintain state 1]/[number of required neighbor cells for a cell to change state from 0 to 1]". The method also sets the rule set through the static method in the Rule class, Rule.setRules.
        Parameters:
        ruleStringTemp - - the rulestring retrieved from the RLE-file
        See Also:
        decryptRLEFile(java.util.List)

        public void readGameBoardFromURL(java.lang.String url)
                          throws java.io.IOException,
                                 PatternFormatException
        Creates an URL-object and uses method readBord with an InputStreamReader to create an InputStreamReader object.
        Parameters:

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown if there are errors reading from the url
        PatternFormatException - thrown if there are errors related to the format of the pattern

      • rletoArray

        @Deprecated
public byte[][] rletoArray(int x,
                                        int y,
                                        java.lang.String rleAryStrng)
        Deprecated. 
        Thomas Dahll rev 10.03 uses the contents from the decryption to create an 2DArray
        Parameters:
        x - value of x in rle
        y - value of y in rle
        rleAryStrng - the string which describes the array
        Returns:

      • encodeArray

        public static java.lang.String encodeArray(java.lang.String arrayString)
        Uses the arrayString to code it into an RLE pattern. This creates a String-representation of the RLE-file which in turn can be written to an RLE-file and be read with RLE-decoders.
        Parameters:
        arrayString - the String representing the pattern in terms of 1s and 0s (alive and dead respectively)
        Returns:
        the RLE-board in String form

      • getRleArray

        public byte[][] getRleArray()
        Gets the rleArray. This contains the byte[][] of the pattern in the RLE-file.
        Returns:
        the byte[][]-representation of the pattern in the RLE-file
